intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. adenosteleum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright purple to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf structure and floral morphology compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
